metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9401 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
popd in bash might allow local users to bypass the restricted shell and cause a use-after-free via a crafted address.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bash - 4.4-5ubuntu1
bash-builtins - 4.4-5ubuntu1
bash-static - 4.4-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> not sure how this has security impact

criterions.comment: bash package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4-5ubuntu1').
